recipe.name: Dicken's Wassail
recipe.notes: I never had a chance to get into this, preferring mulled wine or spiced (and spiked) cider for my yuletide  inebriation needs.  Still -- Dickens, Wassail, how can you go wrong?
recipe.preparation: Put apples into a deep casserole.  Combine 1/4 cup sugar and the water in a saucepan; bring to boil.  Pour syrup over apples.  Cover casserole and bake at 350F 30 to 40 minutes or until apples are tender, basting occasionally.  Pour ale into a saucepan and heat on low heat until it foams.  Add spices, sherry and 1 1/2 cups sugar, lemon peel and lemon juice.  Heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved.  Remove from heat and allow to cool for 20 minutes. Reheat mixture and pour through a double thickness of cheesecloth into a heat resistant punch bowl.  Float apples and serve, garnished with lemon peel.
